doc.after: Fluorine-18 is often found in radioactive tracers for positron emission tomography, as its half-life of almost two hours is long enough to allow for its transport from production facilities to imaging centers.[234] The most common tracer is fluorodeoxyglucose[234] which, after intravenous injection, is taken up by glucose-requiring tissues such as the brain and most malignant tumors;[235] computer-assisted tomography can then be used for detailed imaging.[236]
